page.title: 17THE REV. A.Q. MORTON 2
page.content: His theory is that writers identify themselves by their use of the most frequently used words - 'a', 'the' and the commonest conjunctions and prepositions. The frequency of use and position in the sentence of these words gives an expert like Mr. Morton the information he needs. In lOOO words he can find about l5 habits and could probably identify the writer if he had an authentic sample for comparison. Mr. Morton's fame as an expert in this field has led him to appear as an expert witness in courts as far distant as America and, more recently, Australia.
